info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 2:25AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ....Snow this morning may pose travel difficulties... Snow will develop west to east across southwest Montana, though there is considerable uncertainty in the intensity and areal coverage at this time. New snow accumulations will likely total less than 1 inch at lower elevations, but up to 2 inches in the mountains. Around the greater Bozeman area and the Gallatin River Valley, snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches are expected, with locally higher accumulations to 3 inches south of Bozeman along the north slopes of the Gallatin Range. Snow will end from west to east by early this afternoon. Caution is advised if you are traveling across southwest Montana this morning. Please remember to slow down and allow for extra space between vehicles.
